title: Patient Registration with Valid CPF
description: Verify that a patient can be registered successfully when a valid CPF is provided, including mandatory fields and initial medical history.

steps.description: Navigate to the patient registration page
Enter valid patient details including a correctly formatted and unique CPF
Fill in mandatory medical history fields
Submit the patient registration form
Patient record is created successfully with an assigned ID and displayed in patient list

title: Patient Registration Rejected with Invalid CPF
description: Ensure the system prevents patient registration when an invalid CPF number is entered.

steps.description: Navigate to the patient registration page
Input invalid CPF format
Complete other mandatory fields with valid data
Try to submit the registration form
Form submission is blocked and an appropriate validation error message is shown indicating CPF is invalid

title: Patient Record Deactivation Without Data Loss
description: Validate that a patient record can be deactivated without deleting or losing clinical history data.

steps.description: Locate an existing active patient record
Deactivate the patient record via the interface
Patient is marked as inactive but all previous clinical data remains accessible in the system

title: Create Appointment with Conflict Validation
description: Verify that when scheduling an appointment, the system detects conflicts such as overlapping appointments or missing availability.

steps.description: Open the scheduling calendar and select a date and time slot
Attempt to create an appointment for a professional already booked in that slot
Submit the appointment request
System prevents saving and displays a conflict warning message

title: Drag-and-Drop Rescheduling with Capacity Validation
description: Confirm that appointments can be rescheduled by drag-and-drop in the calendar interface and capacity rules are enforced.

steps.description: Locate an existing appointment on the calendar
Drag the appointment to a new time slot that is available
The appointment reschedules successfully and updates are reflected immediately
Try to drag the appointment to a fully booked time slot or beyond allowed scheduling hours
System rejects the reschedule action and alerts the user to the capacity or scheduling limit

title: Save SOAP Clinical Note with Attachments and Digital Signature
description: Test saving a complete SOAP clinical note including subjective, objective, assessment, plan sections, attached documents, and applying a digital signature.

steps.description: Open the clinical note editor for a patient's session
Fill out all SOAP sections with valid data
Attach relevant supporting documents to the note
Apply digital signature to the note
Save the clinical note
Clinical note is saved with all data, attachments, and signature intact and audit trail is created

title: Auto-Save SOAP Clinical Notes
description: Ensure SOAP clinical notes are periodically auto-saved during editing to prevent data loss.

steps.description: Open a new SOAP note and begin entering data into various fields
Wait for the auto-save interval to pass without manual saving
Data entered is saved automatically and can be recovered upon re-loading the note

title: Exercise Prescription Filtering and Protocol Application
description: Verify that physiotherapists can filter exercises by category and apply evidence-based protocols to personalize patient prescriptions.

steps.description: Open the exercise library interface
Apply various filters such as body region, difficulty, or type
Filtered exercise list matches the selected criteria accurately
Select a protocol and apply it to a patient exercise plan
Protocol exercises populate the prescription correctly with associated parameters

title: Track Patient Progress on Prescribed Exercises
description: Test that patient progress on prescribed exercises is tracked, updated, and can be reviewed in reports.

steps.description: Access a patient's prescribed exercise plan
Input progress metrics such as completion rate, pain level, or time spent
Save the updated progress
Progress updates are saved and reflected in exportable reports and patient records

title: Validated Appointment Confirmation Rate Increase Workflow
description: Verify appointment confirmation workflows are functional and confirmation rate metrics can be generated.

steps.description: Schedule multiple appointments with different patients
Mark appointments as confirmed through available interface options
System updates and displays confirmation rates achieving above 85% when applicable

title: Financial Management: Record Income and Expense Transactions
description: Test the basic financial module for recording income and expense items, checking balance calculations and report accuracy.

steps.description: Navigate to financial management section
Create income transaction (e.g. session payment)
Create expense transaction (e.g. equipment purchase)
Transactions are saved correctly and cash flow calculations update accordingly
Generate financial report showing income and expenses
Report data is accurate and reflects all recorded transactions

title: Role-Based Access Control Validation
description: Confirm that users with different roles (Admin, Receptionist, Physiotherapist, Patient) can access only authorized modules and features.

steps.description: Log in as an Admin user
Admin can access system administration, user management, and analytics
Log out and log in as Receptionist
Receptionist can access appointment scheduling but not system settings
Log out and log in as Physiotherapist
Physiotherapist can access SOAP notes and exercise prescription but not financial management
Log out and log in as Patient
Patient can view own clinical records and prescribed exercises only

title: Audit Log Entry for Critical User Actions
description: Ensure that critical actions such as user creation, patient record editing, and clinical note signing generate appropriate audit log entries.

steps.description: Perform critical action such as creating a new user
Audit log registers the creation event with user, timestamp, and details
Edit a patient clinical record
Audit log captures changes with before and after states
Apply digital signature on a SOAP note
Audit log records signature event linked to user and note

title: System Performance: Loading Patient List Under 2 Seconds
description: Verify that loading the patient list page completes within 2 seconds to support operational efficiency.

steps.description: Navigate to the patient list page with a large dataset
Page fully loads and displays all patients within 2 seconds

title: UI Accessibility Compliance WCAG 2.1 AA
description: Validate that key user interface components meet WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards including keyboard navigation, color contrast, and labels.

steps.description: Navigate through the main UI using keyboard only
All interactive elements are reachable and usable without mouse
Check color contrast ratios for text and backgrounds against WCAG 2.1 AA requirements
Colors meet minimum contrast thresholds
Verify all form fields have descriptive labels and error messages
Labels are programmatically associated with inputs and errors are conveyed clearly
